message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, NMDA receptor is the only receptor that is both voltage-gated and ligand-gated ion channel. It is involved in synaptic plasticity, memory, and learning.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only NMDA receptors are both voltage-gated and ligand-gated ion channels. GABAA receptors and glycine receptors are ligand-gated ion channels only, while Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors are both ionotropic and metabotropic, but not voltage-gated.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only NMDA receptors act as both voltage-gated and ligand-gated ion channels. GABAA and glycine receptors act as ligand-gated ion channels, while nicotinic acetylcholine receptors are ionotropic receptors that act as ligand-gated ion channels.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. NMDA receptors are both voltage-gated and ligand-gated ion channels, meaning they can respond to electrical signals and chemical signals (such as glutamate). GABA and glycine receptors are only ligand-gated ion channels, while nicotinic acetylcholine receptors are only ligand-gated ion channels in most cases.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on neuroscience for help. Among the options, only NMDA receptor is both voltage-gated and ligand-gated ion channel. GABAA and Glycine receptors are only ligand-gated, while Nicotinic acetylcholine receptor is only voltage-gated.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on neuroscience for help. Among the options, only NMDA receptors are both voltage-gated and ligand-gated ion channels. GABAA and glycine receptors are solely ligand-gated ion channels, while nicotinic acetylcholine receptors are solely ligand-gated ion channels that are permeable to both sodium and calcium ions.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only the NMDA receptor is both voltage-gated and ligand-gated. The GABAA receptor and glycine receptor are only ligand-gated ion channels, while the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor is only a ligand-gated ion channel in the peripheral nervous system.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on ion channels for help. NMDA receptor is a type of ionotropic glutamate receptor which is both voltage and ligand-gated, while the other options are only ligand-gated ion channels.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on neuroscience for help. The NMDA receptor is both voltage-gated and ligand-gated, meaning it can be activated by both changes in the electrical potential across the cell membrane and the binding of a specific neurotransmitter, in this case, glutamate. The other options are either ligand-gated or voltage-gated, but not both.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The only receptor among the options that is both voltage-gated and ligand-gated is NMDA receptor. GABAA receptor and Glycine receptor are only ligand-gated ion channels, while Nicotinic acetylcholine receptor is only voltage-gated.
